intro: Amsinckia pustulata, commonly known as the sticky bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its distinctive feature is the presence of sticky, inflated pods that contain seeds. Amsinckia pustulata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
